verses.verse: ((1 David describeth what government he will observe in his house and kingdom.5 He will punish and correct, by rooting forth the wicked,6 and cherishing the godly persons.) ) I will sing mercy and judgment: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.

I will do wisely in the perfect way, (Though as yet thou deferrest to place me in the Kingly dignity, yet will I give myself to wisdom and uprightness being a private man.) till thou comest to me, I will walk in the uprightness of mine heart in the midst of my house.

I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate (He showeth that Magistrates do not their duties, except they be enemies to all vice.) the work of them that fall away: it shall not cleave unto me.
A froward heart shall depart from me; I will know none evil.

Him that privily (In promising to punish these vices, which are most pernicious in them that are about Kings, he declareth that he will punish all.) slandereth his neighbor, will I destroy: him that hath a proud look and high heart, I cannot suffer.

Mine eyes shall be unto the (He showeth what is the true use of the sword: to punish the wicked, and to maintain the good.) faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
There shall no deceitful person dwell within my house: he that telleth lies, shall not remain in my sight.

(Magistrates must immediately punish vice, lest it grow to further inconvenience: and if heathen magistrates are bound to do this, how much more they that have the charge of the Church of God?) Betimes will I destroy all the wicked of the land that I may cut off all the workers of iniquity from the City of the Lord.
